title: Titan of terror: The dark imagination of H.P. Lovecraft - Silvia Moreno-Garc√≠a

multiple-choice.question: What type of terror did Howard Phillips Lovecraft seek to invent in his stories?

options.label: A
options.text: A new kind of terror that responded to the rapid scientific progress of his era.

options.label: B
options.text: A kind of terror that used fantastical folklore.

options.label: C
options.text: A kind of terror that was inspired by real-life horrors.

options.label: D
options.text: A kind of terror that was inspired by graphic violence.

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the author who popularized the elements of terror in modern horror stories?
What was the name of the story where a strange meteorite falls near a farmhouse, mutating the farm into a nightmarish hellscape?
What is the name of the shared universe created by Lovecraft and adopted by other authors?
What was the name of the being described as "who froths as primal slime in nuclear chaos beyond the nethermost outposts of space and time"?
What is the name of the author who corresponded with Lovecraft and employed elements and characters from his stories in his own?
What was the name of the story written as a report of an Antarctic expedition that unearths things better left undiscovered?
What is the name of the god described as having destructive impulses stalled only by the "maddening beating of vile drums and the thin monotonous whine of accursed flutes"?
What was the name of the author who held strong racist views and included crude stereotypes and slurs in his works?
How old was Lovecraft was when he died?

title: The hidden network that makes the internet possible - Sajan Saini

multiple-choice.question: What is the maximum amount of data that a team of Japanese and Danish researchers transmitted over a 50-kilometer cable in a second in 2012?
What is the primary material used to make fiber optic cables?
What phenomenon allows light to travel within glass rather than just pass through it?
What is the main advantage of using fiber optic signals compared to electrical signals?
What is the primary challenge facing cloud computing and mobile devices due to the increasing demand for bandwidth?
What technology has come to the rescue of fiber optics in addressing the challenges of cloud computing and mobile devices?
What is the main advantage of using integrated photonics in mobile devices?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for faster data transfer

options.label: B
options.text: It enables more efficient use of energy

options.label: C
options.text: It reduces the size of devices

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the storage capacity of devices

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge facing the widespread adoption of terahertz frequencies in mobile devices?

options.label: C
options.text: They are too easily absorbed by moisture in the air

options.label: D
options.text: They are too easily blocked by tall buildings

multiple-choice.question: What technology is being developed to address the challenge of terahertz frequencies being easily absorbed by moisture in the air?
What is the ultimate goal of using light to build a virtual world?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the storage capacity of devices

options.label: C
options.text: To redirect information and explore new possibilities

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce the size of devices
